Plot Daily Rainfall (smart axis, optional yearly facets)

Source: R/plot_rainfall.R
plot_rainfall.Rd

Creates a clean ggplot2 line plot of daily rainfall totals with automatic x-axis scaling (months for ≤ 1 year, years for multi-year data) and optional faceting by year.

Usage

plot_rainfall(
  df,
  title = "Daily Rainfall",
  color = "#0072B2",
  linewidth = 0.5,
  facet_by_year = FALSE
)

Arguments

df

A tibble/data frame with at least date (Date) and rain_mm (numeric).

title

Plot title. Default: "Daily Rainfall".

color

Line color. Default: ggplot2 blue ("#0072B2").

linewidth

Line width for geom_line(). Default: 0.5.

facet_by_year

Logical; if TRUE, facet into one panel per calendar year.

Value

A ggplot object.

Examples

data(weather_nl)
# Auto x-axis scaling
plot_rainfall(weather_nl)


# Faceted version
plot_rainfall(weather_nl, facet_by_year = TRUE)


# Custom color and title (ASCII dash)
plot_rainfall(weather_nl, title = "Rainfall in St John's (2008-2023)",
              color = "#56B4E9", linewidth = 0.8)
